Spend_AuthorizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Spend_AuthorizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Spend_AuthorizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Spend_Authorization_Request_References.description: Instance set containing the Spend Authorization object.

description: This element content contains the echoed Spend Authorization Request Reference Element.

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Spend_Authorization_Request_Criteria.description: Reference to an existing Company or Company Hierarchy

Expense_PayeeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Expense_PayeeObjectID.type: WID,  Academic_Person_ID,  Applicant_ID,  Candidate_ID,  Contingent_Worker_ID,  Employee_ID,  External_Committee_Member_ID,  Student_ID,  Universal_Identifier_ID
Expense_PayeeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Expense_PayeeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Spend_Authorization_Request_Criteria.description: Reference to an existing Expense Payee.

Payee_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Payee_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Payee_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Spend_Authorization_Request_Criteria.description: The Expense Payee Type on the Spend Authorization - Employee, Contingent Worker, or External Committee Member.

description: This element content contains the echoed Spend Authorization Request Criteria Element.

validation.validation: Created From Date must be earlier than Created To Date
Approved From Date must be earlier than Approved To Date
Organization Reference must be Companies or Company Hierarchies
Spend Authorization From Date must be earlier than Spend Authorization To Date

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: This element content contains the echoed Respones Filter Element

Spend_Authorization_Response_Group.description: Flag indicating if the Spend Authorization Reference data is to be included in the response
Flag indicating if the Spend Authorization data is to be included in the response
Flag indicating if the attachment data within Spend Authorization Data is to be included in the response

description: This element content contains the echoed Spend Authorization Response Group Element.
